basics.name: Gilbert Kibet-Rono
basics.label: Genomics & Bioinformatics Research Associate
basics.summary: I am a bioinformatician focusing on pathogen genomics: NGS sequencing, high-throughput analysis, and open, reproducible scientific research.

work.name: International Livestock Research Institute (ILRI)
work.summary: Metagenomic, viral, bacterial, wastewater and single-cell NGS analysis.
highlights: Library preparation and sequencing using Illumina and ONT platforms.
Bioinformatics Pipeline development (Nextflow, Linux, git & GitHub)
Bioinformatics Analysis in a local HPC cluster and using SLURM
Data management, curation and submission to NCBI, GISAID.
Statistical analysis with R & Python, visualization, manuscript drafting.

volunteer.summary: Co-developed a ten-hour open course on preprints in life sciences.
highlights: Updated and Updloaded the content to ASAPbio's GitHub repo
I advocate for open science and preprints among early-career researchers

education.institution: Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology (JKUAT)

publications.name: Genomic Epidemiology of SARS-CoV-2 Lineages in Kenya, 2020–2022
publications.summary: Sequencing and analysis of over 1,200 SARS-CoV-2 genomes in East Africa revealing regional spread and variant emergence.

publications.name: Wastewater-based Surveillance of Pathogens and AMR Genes in Nairobi
publications.summary: Developed a metagenomic pipeline and analyzed community-level prevalence of key antimicrobial resistance markers.

projects.name: Wastewater Pathogen and AMR surveillance through shotgun metagenomics
projects.summary: I develop and maintain a Nextflow pipeline for processing 1000+ samples on Slurm HPC; includes QC, assembly, taxonomy, AMR profiling.
